column3: What wonders me most is why it won't try the fallback URL\n
Not sure, but even if it did, it would fail. Note the second commit I had to add for the OSX SDK on bitcoincore.org :/\n

Why is the MacOSX SDK download broken too?

I don't think I understand what is the issue here. Is that site irrevocably broken, or is there some certificate issue? (e.g. missing ca-certificates package?) But in that case you'd expect any tool to fail.

Switching to another tool is possible but I'd like to know what is wrong first. It seems like a heavy-handed solution.

@theuni any idea?
Seems to be a wget bug in the ancient 12.02 Ubuntu that Travis uses. But I could be wrong.\n
Bleh. We need 14.04 support for other reasons too (e.g. c++11).\n
It looks like 14.04 is possible, but... only be losing IPv6 localhost support [again]. :/\n
Note: curl needs -L to follow redirects.\n
This fixes the Travis-side CI issues: https://travis-ci.org/luke-jr/bitcoin/builds/108146026\n
Is it required to set `--location` and `-L`?\n
